info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, NORTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN BOONE AND SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Rising Sun, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Edgewood, Elsmere, Cheviot, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Taylor Mill, Fort Wright, Ludlow, Crescent Springs, Crestview Hills, Park Hills, Lakeside Park, Rising Sun, Oakbrook and Burlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
